description: The strategy aims to increase exports and productivity of the cotton sector in the UEMOA (Union Economique et Monétaire Ouest-Africaine) countries. The five main strategic objectives are: 1) increasing productivity; 2) improving quality of product; 3) promoting the sales of UEMOA cotton products within the region and abroad; 4) promoting the transformation and update of the production chain; 5) promoting the development of the cotton-seed value chain. The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Benin

description: The DTIS provides an overview of the current economic situation in Angola and of the main issues regarding poverty and trade. It analyses the key problems affecting infrastructures, trade regime and institutions, commercial barriers, trade facilitation and private sector development.

Furthermore, the strategy addresses cross-cutting issues such as gender, environment, climate change, knowledge management and networking, macroeconomic convergence.

description: The Diagnostic Trade Integration Study provides an analysis of Uganda’s recent economic and trade performance, and it outlines recommendations in order to increase its integration into the world trading system and mainstream good trade policies into national policy-making. In particular the study deals with sub-sector specific as well as economy-wide issues. Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.

description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. Hence, it focuses on four main results, namely: 1) Inclusive and sustainable growth is promoted by reducing disparities and expanding economic opportunities for vulnerable groups; 2) Democratic governance is strengthened by improving accountability, promoting institutional and capacity development and expanding people’s participation; 3) Access and quality of social services is improved especially for vulnerable groups; 4) Environment and disaster risk reduction is integrated into national and local development frameworks.

description: The strategy aims to increase exports and productivity of the cotton sector in the UEMOA (Union Economique et Monétaire Ouest-Africaine) countries. description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. title: UEMOA Cotton and Textile Strategy

description: The DTIS provides an overview of the current economic situation in Angola and of the main issues regarding poverty and trade. It analyses the key problems affecting infrastructures, trade regime and institutions, commercial barriers, trade facilitation and private sector development.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Benin

description: The strategy aims to increase exports and productivity of the cotton sector in the UEMOA (Union Economique et Monétaire Ouest-Africaine) countries. The five main strategic objectives are: 1) increasing productivity; 2) improving quality of product; 3) promoting the sales of UEMOA cotton products within the region and abroad; 4) promoting the transformation and update of the production chain; 5) promoting the development of the cotton-seed value chain. The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.

description: The Diagnostic Trade Integration Study provides an analysis of Uganda’s recent economic and trade performance, and it outlines recommendations in order to increase its integration into the world trading system and mainstream good trade policies into national policy-making. In particular the study deals with sub-sector specific as well as economy-wide issues. Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Benin

description: The document provides an overview of the current political, economic and social context of the region, setting the regional strategic objectives and identifying the key challenges and opportunities. The strategy rotates around two pillars: regional infrastructure and capacity building; and it focuses on areas such as regional transport/trade facilitation infrastructure, regional Energy Development, information and communication technology, support to the CES Tripartite Arrangement, institutional strengthening, trade and transport facilitation and aid for trade. Furthermore, the strategy addresses cross-cutting issues such as gender, environment, climate change, knowledge management and networking, macroeconomic convergence.

Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.
title: UNDAF Argentina 2011-2014

description: The strategy aims to increase exports and productivity of the cotton sector in the UEMOA (Union Economique et Monétaire Ouest-Africaine) countries. The five main strategic objectives are: 1) increasing productivity; 2) improving quality of product; 3) promoting the sales of UEMOA cotton products within the region and abroad; 4) promoting the transformation and update of the production chain; 5) promoting the development of the cotton-seed value chain. The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.
title: UNDAF Argentina 2011-2014

description: The UNDAF outlines four main areas of cooperation between the UN country team and the government of Argentina, namely: 1) sustainable productive development; 2) social inclusion and equality; 3) management and access to social welfare services; 4) institutional development.
title: Government of Albania and United Nations Programme of Cooperation 2012-2016

description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. Hence, it focuses on four main results, namely: 1) Inclusive and sustainable growth is promoted by reducing disparities and expanding economic opportunities for vulnerable groups; 2) Democratic governance is strengthened by improving accountability, promoting institutional and capacity development and expanding people’s participation; 3) Access and quality of social services is improved especially for vulnerable groups; 4) Environment and disaster risk reduction is integrated into national and local development frameworks.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Uganda

description: The DTIS provides an overview of the current economic situation in Angola and of the main issues regarding poverty and trade. It analyses the key problems affecting infrastructures, trade regime and institutions, commercial barriers, trade facilitation and private sector development.
title: UEMOA Cotton and Textile Strategy

description: The UNDAF outlines four main areas of cooperation between the UN country team and the government of Argentina, namely: 1) sustainable productive development; 2) social inclusion and equality; 3) management and access to social welfare services; 4) institutional development.
title: UNDAF Armenia 2010-2015

description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. Hence, it focuses on four main results, namely: 1) Inclusive and sustainable growth is promoted by reducing disparities and expanding economic opportunities for vulnerable groups; 2) Democratic governance is strengthened by improving accountability, promoting institutional and capacity development and expanding people’s participation; 3) Access and quality of social services is improved especially for vulnerable groups; 4) Environment and disaster risk reduction is integrated into national and local development frameworks.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Uganda

description: The Diagnostic Trade Integration Study provides an analysis of Uganda’s recent economic and trade performance, and it outlines recommendations in order to increase its integration into the world trading system and mainstream good trade policies into national policy-making. In particular the study deals with sub-sector specific as well as economy-wide issues. Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.
title: UNDAF Armenia 2010-2015

title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Benin

description: The strategy aims to increase exports and productivity of the cotton sector in the UEMOA (Union Economique et Monétaire Ouest-Africaine) countries. The five main strategic objectives are: 1) increasing productivity; 2) improving quality of product; 3) promoting the sales of UEMOA cotton products within the region and abroad; 4) promoting the transformation and update of the production chain; 5) promoting the development of the cotton-seed value chain. The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.

title: UNDAF Armenia 2010-2015

description: The document provides an overview of the current political, economic and social context of the region, setting the regional strategic objectives and identifying the key challenges and opportunities. The strategy rotates around two pillars: regional infrastructure and capacity building; and it focuses on areas such as regional transport/trade facilitation infrastructure, regional Energy Development, information and communication technology, support to the CES Tripartite Arrangement, institutional strengthening, trade and transport facilitation and aid for trade. Furthermore, the strategy addresses cross-cutting issues such as gender, environment, climate change, knowledge management and networking, macroeconomic convergence.

In particular the study deals with sub-sector specific as well as economy-wide issues. Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.
title: UEMOA Cotton and Textile Strategy

description: The UNDAF outlines four main areas of cooperation between the UN country team and the government of Argentina, namely: 1) sustainable productive development; 2) social inclusion and equality; 3) management and access to social welfare services; 4) institutional development.
title: Government of Albania and United Nations Programme of Cooperation 2012-2016

description: The strategy aims to increase exports and productivity of the cotton sector in the UEMOA (Union Economique et Monétaire Ouest-Africaine) countries. The five main strategic objectives are: 1) increasing productivity; 2) improving quality of product; 3) promoting the sales of UEMOA cotton products within the region and abroad; 4) promoting the transformation and update of the production chain; 5) promoting the development of the cotton-seed value chain. The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.
title: UNDAF Argentina 2011-2014

description: The strategy aims to increase exports and productivity of the cotton sector in the UEMOA (Union Economique et Monétaire Ouest-Africaine) countries. title: UNDAF Armenia 2010-2015

description: The document provides an overview of the current political, economic and social context of the region, setting the regional strategic objectives and identifying the key challenges and opportunities. The strategy rotates around two pillars: regional infrastructure and capacity building; and it focuses on areas such as regional transport/trade facilitation infrastructure, regional Energy Development, information and communication technology, support to the CES Tripartite Arrangement, institutional strengthening, trade and transport facilitation and aid for trade. Furthermore, the strategy addresses cross-cutting issues such as gender, environment, climate change, knowledge management and networking, macroeconomic convergence.

description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. Hence, it focuses on four main results, namely: 1) Inclusive and sustainable growth is promoted by reducing disparities and expanding economic opportunities for vulnerable groups; 2) Democratic governance is strengthened by improving accountability, promoting institutional and capacity development and expanding people’s participation; 3) Access and quality of social services is improved especially for vulnerable groups; 4) Environment and disaster risk reduction is integrated into national and local development frameworks.
title: UNDAF Armenia 2010-2015

description: The DTIS provides an overview of the current economic situation in Angola and of the main issues regarding poverty and trade. It analyses the key problems affecting infrastructures, trade regime and institutions, commercial barriers, trade facilitation and private sector development.
title: Government of Albania and United Nations Programme of Cooperation 2012-2016

description: The strategy aims to increase exports and productivity of the cotton sector in the UEMOA (Union Economique et Monétaire Ouest-Africaine) countries. The five main strategic objectives are: 1) increasing productivity; 2) improving quality of product; 3) promoting the sales of UEMOA cotton products within the region and abroad; 4) promoting the transformation and update of the production chain; 5) promoting the development of the cotton-seed value chain. The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.
title: Government of Albania and United Nations Programme of Cooperation 2012-2016

description: The document provides an overview of the current political, economic and social context of the region, setting the regional strategic objectives and identifying the key challenges and opportunities. The strategy rotates around two pillars: regional infrastructure and capacity building; and it focuses on areas such as regional transport/trade facilitation infrastructure, regional Energy Development, information and communication technology, support to the CES Tripartite Arrangement, institutional strengthening, trade and transport facilitation and aid for trade. Furthermore, the strategy addresses cross-cutting issues such as gender, environment, climate change, knowledge management and networking, macroeconomic convergence.

description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. Hence, it focuses on four main results, namely: 1) Inclusive and sustainable growth is promoted by reducing disparities and expanding economic opportunities for vulnerable groups; 2) Democratic governance is strengthened by improving accountability, promoting institutional and capacity development and expanding people’s participation; 3) Access and quality of social services is improved especially for vulnerable groups; 4) Environment and disaster risk reduction is integrated into national and local development frameworks.

title: UNDAF Argentina 2011-2014

description: The Diagnostic Trade Integration Study provides an analysis of Uganda’s recent economic and trade performance, and it outlines recommendations in order to increase its integration into the world trading system and mainstream good trade policies into national policy-making. In particular the study deals with sub-sector specific as well as economy-wide issues. Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.

description: The Diagnostic Trade Integration Study provides an analysis of Uganda’s recent economic and trade performance, and it outlines recommendations in order to increase its integration into the world trading system and mainstream good trade policies into national policy-making. In particular the study deals with sub-sector specific as well as economy-wide issues. Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.

description: The UNDAF outlines four main areas of cooperation between the UN country team and the government of Argentina, namely: 1) sustainable productive development; 2) social inclusion and equality; 3) management and access to social welfare services; 4) institutional development.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Uganda

description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. Hence, it focuses on four main results, namely: 1) Inclusive and sustainable growth is promoted by reducing disparities and expanding economic opportunities for vulnerable groups; 2) Democratic governance is strengthened by improving accountability, promoting institutional and capacity development and expanding people’s participation; 3) Access and quality of social services is improved especially for vulnerable groups; 4) Environment and disaster risk reduction is integrated into national and local development frameworks.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Uganda

title: Government of Albania and United Nations Programme of Cooperation 2012-2016

description: The strategy aims to increase exports and productivity of the cotton sector in the UEMOA (Union Economique et Monétaire Ouest-Africaine) countries. The five main strategic objectives are: 1) increasing productivity; 2) improving quality of product; 3) promoting the sales of UEMOA cotton products within the region and abroad; 4) promoting the transformation and update of the production chain; 5) promoting the development of the cotton-seed value chain. The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.

description: The Diagnostic Trade Integration Study provides an analysis of Uganda’s recent economic and trade performance, and it outlines recommendations in order to increase its integration into the world trading system and mainstream good trade policies into national policy-making. In particular the study deals with sub-sector specific as well as economy-wide issues. Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.

In particular the study deals with sub-sector specific as well as economy-wide issues. Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.

title: Government of Albania and United Nations Programme of Cooperation 2012-2016

description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. Hence, it focuses on four main results, namely: 1) Inclusive and sustainable growth is promoted by reducing disparities and expanding economic opportunities for vulnerable groups; 2) Democratic governance is strengthened by improving accountability, promoting institutional and capacity development and expanding people’s participation; 3) Access and quality of social services is improved especially for vulnerable groups; 4) Environment and disaster risk reduction is integrated into national and local development frameworks.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Benin

description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. title: UNDAF Armenia 2010-2015

description: The DTIS provides an overview of the current economic situation in Angola and of the main issues regarding poverty and trade. It analyses the key problems affecting infrastructures, trade regime and institutions, commercial barriers, trade facilitation and private sector development.
title: UEMOA Cotton and Textile Strategy

description: The strategy aims to increase exports and productivity of the cotton sector in the UEMOA (Union Economique et Monétaire Ouest-Africaine) countries. The five main strategic objectives are: 1) increasing productivity; 2) improving quality of product; 3) promoting the sales of UEMOA cotton products within the region and abroad; 4) promoting the transformation and update of the production chain; 5) promoting the development of the cotton-seed value chain. The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.

title: Southern Africa ADB Regional Integration Strategy Paper

description: The document provides an overview of the current political, economic and social context of the region, setting the regional strategic objectives and identifying the key challenges and opportunities. The strategy rotates around two pillars: regional infrastructure and capacity building; and it focuses on areas such as regional transport/trade facilitation infrastructure, regional Energy Development, information and communication technology, support to the CES Tripartite Arrangement, institutional strengthening, trade and transport facilitation and aid for trade. Furthermore, the strategy addresses cross-cutting issues such as gender, environment, climate change, knowledge management and networking, macroeconomic convergence.

Hence, it focuses on four main results, namely: 1) Inclusive and sustainable growth is promoted by reducing disparities and expanding economic opportunities for vulnerable groups; 2) Democratic governance is strengthened by improving accountability, promoting institutional and capacity development and expanding people’s participation; 3) Access and quality of social services is improved especially for vulnerable groups; 4) Environment and disaster risk reduction is integrated into national and local development frameworks.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Benin

description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. Hence, it focuses on four main results, namely: 1) Inclusive and sustainable growth is promoted by reducing disparities and expanding economic opportunities for vulnerable groups; 2) Democratic governance is strengthened by improving accountability, promoting institutional and capacity development and expanding people’s participation; 3) Access and quality of social services is improved especially for vulnerable groups; 4) Environment and disaster risk reduction is integrated into national and local development frameworks.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Benin

description: The Diagnostic Trade Integration Study provides an analysis of Uganda’s recent economic and trade performance, and it outlines recommendations in order to increase its integration into the world trading system and mainstream good trade policies into national policy-making. In particular the study deals with sub-sector specific as well as economy-wide issues. Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.
title: Government of Albania and United Nations Programme of Cooperation 2012-2016

description: The document provides an overview of the current political, economic and social context of the region, setting the regional strategic objectives and identifying the key challenges and opportunities. The strategy rotates around two pillars: regional infrastructure and capacity building; and it focuses on areas such as regional transport/trade facilitation infrastructure, regional Energy Development, information and communication technology, support to the CES Tripartite Arrangement, institutional strengthening, trade and transport facilitation and aid for trade. Furthermore, the strategy addresses cross-cutting issues such as gender, environment, climate change, knowledge management and networking, macroeconomic convergence.

title: UNDAF Armenia 2010-2015

description: The strategy aims to increase exports and productivity of the cotton sector in the UEMOA (Union Economique et Monétaire Ouest-Africaine) countries. The five main strategic objectives are: 1) increasing productivity; 2) improving quality of product; 3) promoting the sales of UEMOA cotton products within the region and abroad; 4) promoting the transformation and update of the production chain; 5) promoting the development of the cotton-seed value chain. The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.

The five main strategic objectives are: 1) increasing productivity; 2) improving quality of product; 3) promoting the sales of UEMOA cotton products within the region and abroad; 4) promoting the transformation and update of the production chain; 5) promoting the development of the cotton-seed value chain. The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Benin

description: The DTIS provides an overview of the current economic situation in Angola and of the main issues regarding poverty and trade. It analyses the key problems affecting infrastructures, trade regime and institutions, commercial barriers, trade facilitation and private sector development.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Uganda

description: The strategy aims to increase exports and productivity of the cotton sector in the UEMOA (Union Economique et Monétaire Ouest-Africaine) countries. title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Benin

description: The Diagnostic Trade Integration Study provides an analysis of Uganda’s recent economic and trade performance, and it outlines recommendations in order to increase its integration into the world trading system and mainstream good trade policies into national policy-making. In particular the study deals with sub-sector specific as well as economy-wide issues. Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.
title: UNDAF Armenia 2010-2015

description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. Hence, it focuses on four main results, namely: 1) Inclusive and sustainable growth is promoted by reducing disparities and expanding economic opportunities for vulnerable groups; 2) Democratic governance is strengthened by improving accountability, promoting institutional and capacity development and expanding people’s participation; 3) Access and quality of social services is improved especially for vulnerable groups; 4) Environment and disaster risk reduction is integrated into national and local development frameworks.
title: Government of Albania and United Nations Programme of Cooperation 2012-2016

title: Southern Africa ADB Regional Integration Strategy Paper

description: The document provides an overview of the current political, economic and social context of the region, setting the regional strategic objectives and identifying the key challenges and opportunities. The strategy rotates around two pillars: regional infrastructure and capacity building; and it focuses on areas such as regional transport/trade facilitation infrastructure, regional Energy Development, information and communication technology, support to the CES Tripartite Arrangement, institutional strengthening, trade and transport facilitation and aid for trade. Furthermore, the strategy addresses cross-cutting issues such as gender, environment, climate change, knowledge management and networking, macroeconomic convergence.

The five main strategic objectives are: 1) increasing productivity; 2) improving quality of product; 3) promoting the sales of UEMOA cotton products within the region and abroad; 4) promoting the transformation and update of the production chain; 5) promoting the development of the cotton-seed value chain. The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Benin

description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. Hence, it focuses on four main results, namely: 1) Inclusive and sustainable growth is promoted by reducing disparities and expanding economic opportunities for vulnerable groups; 2) Democratic governance is strengthened by improving accountability, promoting institutional and capacity development and expanding people’s participation; 3) Access and quality of social services is improved especially for vulnerable groups; 4) Environment and disaster risk reduction is integrated into national and local development frameworks.
title: UEMOA Cotton and Textile Strategy

description: The UNDAF outlines four main areas of cooperation between the UN country team and the government of Argentina, namely: 1) sustainable productive development; 2) social inclusion and equality; 3) management and access to social welfare services; 4) institutional development.
title: UNDAF Argentina 2011-2014

description: The Diagnostic Trade Integration Study provides an analysis of Uganda’s recent economic and trade performance, and it outlines recommendations in order to increase its integration into the world trading system and mainstream good trade policies into national policy-making. In particular the study deals with sub-sector specific as well as economy-wide issues. Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.

title: UNDAF Armenia 2010-2015

description: The document provides an overview of the current political, economic and social context of the region, setting the regional strategic objectives and identifying the key challenges and opportunities. The strategy rotates around two pillars: regional infrastructure and capacity building; and it focuses on areas such as regional transport/trade facilitation infrastructure, regional Energy Development, information and communication technology, support to the CES Tripartite Arrangement, institutional strengthening, trade and transport facilitation and aid for trade. Furthermore, the strategy addresses cross-cutting issues such as gender, environment, climate change, knowledge management and networking, macroeconomic convergence.

description: The UNDAF outlines four main areas of cooperation between the UN country team and the government of Argentina, namely: 1) sustainable productive development; 2) social inclusion and equality; 3) management and access to social welfare services; 4) institutional development.
title: UNDAF Argentina 2011-2014

description: The DTIS provides an overview of the current economic situation in Angola and of the main issues regarding poverty and trade. It analyses the key problems affecting infrastructures, trade regime and institutions, commercial barriers, trade facilitation and private sector development.
title: UEMOA Cotton and Textile Strategy

description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. Hence, it focuses on four main results, namely: 1) Inclusive and sustainable growth is promoted by reducing disparities and expanding economic opportunities for vulnerable groups; 2) Democratic governance is strengthened by improving accountability, promoting institutional and capacity development and expanding people’s participation; 3) Access and quality of social services is improved especially for vulnerable groups; 4) Environment and disaster risk reduction is integrated into national and local development frameworks.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Uganda

description: The Diagnostic Trade Integration Study provides an analysis of Uganda’s recent economic and trade performance, and it outlines recommendations in order to increase its integration into the world trading system and mainstream good trade policies into national policy-making. In particular the study deals with sub-sector specific as well as economy-wide issues. Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.
title: Government of Albania and United Nations Programme of Cooperation 2012-2016

description: The strategy aims to increase exports and productivity of the cotton sector in the UEMOA (Union Economique et Monétaire Ouest-Africaine) countries. The five main strategic objectives are: 1) increasing productivity; 2) improving quality of product; 3) promoting the sales of UEMOA cotton products within the region and abroad; 4) promoting the transformation and update of the production chain; 5) promoting the development of the cotton-seed value chain. The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.
title: UNDAF Armenia 2010-2015

The five main strategic objectives are: 1) increasing productivity; 2) improving quality of product; 3) promoting the sales of UEMOA cotton products within the region and abroad; 4) promoting the transformation and update of the production chain; 5) promoting the development of the cotton-seed value chain. The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.
title: Government of Albania and United Nations Programme of Cooperation 2012-2016

description: The document provides an overview of the current political, economic and social context of the region, setting the regional strategic objectives and identifying the key challenges and opportunities. The strategy rotates around two pillars: regional infrastructure and capacity building; and it focuses on areas such as regional transport/trade facilitation infrastructure, regional Energy Development, information and communication technology, support to the CES Tripartite Arrangement, institutional strengthening, trade and transport facilitation and aid for trade. Furthermore, the strategy addresses cross-cutting issues such as gender, environment, climate change, knowledge management and networking, macroeconomic convergence.

description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. Hence, it focuses on four main results, namely: 1) Inclusive and sustainable growth is promoted by reducing disparities and expanding economic opportunities for vulnerable groups; 2) Democratic governance is strengthened by improving accountability, promoting institutional and capacity development and expanding people’s participation; 3) Access and quality of social services is improved especially for vulnerable groups; 4) Environment and disaster risk reduction is integrated into national and local development frameworks.

description: The document provides an overview of the current political, economic and social context of the region, setting the regional strategic objectives and identifying the key challenges and opportunities. title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Uganda

description: The Diagnostic Trade Integration Study provides an analysis of Uganda’s recent economic and trade performance, and it outlines recommendations in order to increase its integration into the world trading system and mainstream good trade policies into national policy-making. In particular the study deals with sub-sector specific as well as economy-wide issues. Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.

description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. Hence, it focuses on four main results, namely: 1) Inclusive and sustainable growth is promoted by reducing disparities and expanding economic opportunities for vulnerable groups; 2) Democratic governance is strengthened by improving accountability, promoting institutional and capacity development and expanding people’s participation; 3) Access and quality of social services is improved especially for vulnerable groups; 4) Environment and disaster risk reduction is integrated into national and local development frameworks.

title: UNDAF Argentina 2011-2014

description: The Diagnostic Trade Integration Study provides an analysis of Uganda’s recent economic and trade performance, and it outlines recommendations in order to increase its integration into the world trading system and mainstream good trade policies into national policy-making. In particular the study deals with sub-sector specific as well as economy-wide issues. Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.

title: UEMOA Cotton and Textile Strategy

description: The strategy aims to increase exports and productivity of the cotton sector in the UEMOA (Union Economique et Monétaire Ouest-Africaine) countries. The five main strategic objectives are: 1) increasing productivity; 2) improving quality of product; 3) promoting the sales of UEMOA cotton products within the region and abroad; 4) promoting the transformation and update of the production chain; 5) promoting the development of the cotton-seed value chain. The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.

Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.
title: UEMOA Cotton and Textile Strategy

description: The document provides an overview of the current political, economic and social context of the region, setting the regional strategic objectives and identifying the key challenges and opportunities. The strategy rotates around two pillars: regional infrastructure and capacity building; and it focuses on areas such as regional transport/trade facilitation infrastructure, regional Energy Development, information and communication technology, support to the CES Tripartite Arrangement, institutional strengthening, trade and transport facilitation and aid for trade. Furthermore, the strategy addresses cross-cutting issues such as gender, environment, climate change, knowledge management and networking, macroeconomic convergence.
title: Government of Albania and United Nations Programme of Cooperation 2012-2016

description: The Diagnostic Trade Integration Study provides an analysis of Uganda’s recent economic and trade performance, and it outlines recommendations in order to increase its integration into the world trading system and mainstream good trade policies into national policy-making. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Benin

description: The UNDAF outlines four main areas of cooperation between the UN country team and the government of Argentina, namely: 1) sustainable productive development; 2) social inclusion and equality; 3) management and access to social welfare services; 4) institutional development.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Benin

description: The DTIS provides an overview of the current economic situation in Angola and of the main issues regarding poverty and trade. It analyses the key problems affecting infrastructures, trade regime and institutions, commercial barriers, trade facilitation and private sector development.
title: Government of Albania and United Nations Programme of Cooperation 2012-2016

description: The UNDAF outlines four main areas of cooperation between the UN country team and the government of Argentina, namely: 1) sustainable productive development; 2) social inclusion and equality; 3) management and access to social welfare services; 4) institutional development.
title: UNDAF Armenia 2010-2015

description: The strategy aims to increase exports and productivity of the cotton sector in the UEMOA (Union Economique et Monétaire Ouest-Africaine) countries. The five main strategic objectives are: 1) increasing productivity; 2) improving quality of product; 3) promoting the sales of UEMOA cotton products within the region and abroad; 4) promoting the transformation and update of the production chain; 5) promoting the development of the cotton-seed value chain. The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.

description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. Hence, it focuses on four main results, namely: 1) Inclusive and sustainable growth is promoted by reducing disparities and expanding economic opportunities for vulnerable groups; 2) Democratic governance is strengthened by improving accountability, promoting institutional and capacity development and expanding people’s participation; 3) Access and quality of social services is improved especially for vulnerable groups; 4) Environment and disaster risk reduction is integrated into national and local development frameworks.

title: Southern Africa ADB Regional Integration Strategy Paper

description: The document provides an overview of the current political, economic and social context of the region, setting the regional strategic objectives and identifying the key challenges and opportunities. The strategy rotates around two pillars: regional infrastructure and capacity building; and it focuses on areas such as regional transport/trade facilitation infrastructure, regional Energy Development, information and communication technology, support to the CES Tripartite Arrangement, institutional strengthening, trade and transport facilitation and aid for trade. Furthermore, the strategy addresses cross-cutting issues such as gender, environment, climate change, knowledge management and networking, macroeconomic convergence.
title: Government of Albania and United Nations Programme of Cooperation 2012-2016

description: The Diagnostic Trade Integration Study provides an analysis of Uganda’s recent economic and trade performance, and it outlines recommendations in order to increase its integration into the world trading system and mainstream good trade policies into national policy-making. In particular the study deals with sub-sector specific as well as economy-wide issues. Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Uganda

description: The DTIS provides an overview of the current economic situation in Angola and of the main issues regarding poverty and trade. It analyses the key problems affecting infrastructures, trade regime and institutions, commercial barriers, trade facilitation and private sector development.
title: UNDAF Armenia 2010-2015

description: The UNDAF outlines four main areas of cooperation between the UN country team and the government of Argentina, namely: 1) sustainable productive development; 2) social inclusion and equality; 3) management and access to social welfare services; 4) institutional development.

title: Southern Africa ADB Regional Integration Strategy Paper

description: The strategy aims to increase exports and productivity of the cotton sector in the UEMOA (Union Economique et Monétaire Ouest-Africaine) countries. The five main strategic objectives are: 1) increasing productivity; 2) improving quality of product; 3) promoting the sales of UEMOA cotton products within the region and abroad; 4) promoting the transformation and update of the production chain; 5) promoting the development of the cotton-seed value chain. The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.

The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.
title: Government of Albania and United Nations Programme of Cooperation 2012-2016

description: The document provides an overview of the current political, economic and social context of the region, setting the regional strategic objectives and identifying the key challenges and opportunities. The strategy rotates around two pillars: regional infrastructure and capacity building; and it focuses on areas such as regional transport/trade facilitation infrastructure, regional Energy Development, information and communication technology, support to the CES Tripartite Arrangement, institutional strengthening, trade and transport facilitation and aid for trade. Furthermore, the strategy addresses cross-cutting issues such as gender, environment, climate change, knowledge management and networking, macroeconomic convergence.
title: Southern Africa ADB Regional Integration Strategy Paper

description: The Diagnostic Trade Integration Study provides an analysis of Uganda’s recent economic and trade performance, and it outlines recommendations in order to increase its integration into the world trading system and mainstream good trade policies into national policy-making. In particular the study deals with sub-sector specific as well as economy-wide issues. Among the latter ones, it focuses on power generation, transport and trade facilitation, access to finance, trade policies, regional trade agreements, customs procedures, trade and export development institutions, and sanitary, phyto-sanitary and other standards. Furthermore, the study analyzes Uganda’s access to export markets, concentrating in particular on the European Union and on the potential worldwide developments following the Doha Round.
title: Southern Africa ADB Regional Integration Strategy Paper

description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. Hence, it focuses on four main results, namely: 1) Inclusive and sustainable growth is promoted by reducing disparities and expanding economic opportunities for vulnerable groups; 2) Democratic governance is strengthened by improving accountability, promoting institutional and capacity development and expanding people’s participation; 3) Access and quality of social services is improved especially for vulnerable groups; 4) Environment and disaster risk reduction is integrated into national and local development frameworks.

The strategy rotates around two pillars: regional infrastructure and capacity building; and it focuses on areas such as regional transport/trade facilitation infrastructure, regional Energy Development, information and communication technology, support to the CES Tripartite Arrangement, institutional strengthening, trade and transport facilitation and aid for trade. Furthermore, the strategy addresses cross-cutting issues such as gender, environment, climate change, knowledge management and networking, macroeconomic convergence.
title: UNDAF Armenia 2010-2015

description: The UNDAF outlines four main areas of cooperation between the UN country team and the government of Argentina, namely: 1) sustainable productive development; 2) social inclusion and equality; 3) management and access to social welfare services; 4) institutional development.
title: Government of Albania and United Nations Programme of Cooperation 2012-2016

description: The United Nations Development Assistance Framework analyses the current social and economic situation in Armenia, focusing on demography, health systems, education, social protection, gender, governance and capacity development, human rights, environment and disaster management and risk reduction. Hence, it focuses on four main results, namely: 1) Inclusive and sustainable growth is promoted by reducing disparities and expanding economic opportunities for vulnerable groups; 2) Democratic governance is strengthened by improving accountability, promoting institutional and capacity development and expanding people’s participation; 3) Access and quality of social services is improved especially for vulnerable groups; 4) Environment and disaster risk reduction is integrated into national and local development frameworks.
title: UEMOA Cotton and Textile Strategy

description: The strategy aims to increase exports and productivity of the cotton sector in the UEMOA (Union Economique et Monétaire Ouest-Africaine) countries. The five main strategic objectives are: 1) increasing productivity; 2) improving quality of product; 3) promoting the sales of UEMOA cotton products within the region and abroad; 4) promoting the transformation and update of the production chain; 5) promoting the development of the cotton-seed value chain. The document provides a detailed analysis of the cotton value chain in the UEMOA countries, and it outlines the future prospects of the world cotton market. In addition, it sets a precise framework for the implementation of the strategy.
title: Diagnostic Trade Integration Study - Uganda
